content: A train travels from Town A to Town B in 3 hours. The distance between the two towns is 180 miles. What is the average speed of the train in miles per hour?

To find the average speed of the train, we can use the formula:

\[
\text{average speed} = \frac{\text{total distance}}{\text{total time}}
\]

Given that the distance between Town A and Town B is 180 miles and the time taken is 3 hours, we can plug these values into the formula:

\[
\text{average speed} = \frac{180 \text{ miles}}{3 \text{ hours}} = 60 \text{ miles per hour}
\]

So, the average speed of the train is 60 miles per hour.
